articles.title: Just two doctors serve this small Alabama town. What's next when they want to retire? - NPR
articles.description: Like much of rural America, LaFayette, Alabama, has no hospital or urgent care clinic. As the town's two primary care doctors approach retirement, some experiments are bubbling up to care for people.
articles.content:
Dr. Terry Vester examines Charity Hodge at Vester's clinic in LaFayette, Alabama. Vester and her husband are the only primary care doctors in the community.
Arielle Zionts/KFF Health News
LaFAYETTE… [+9110 chars]
